entry.title: Dovecote
entry.summary:
Author: KilldevilandtheWildThings

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 86,282Chapters: 16/23Kudos: 129

Summary: Buck held the little plastic bird close in front of his eyes, twisting it back and forth.“You can say it, Buck,” Eddie encouraged, quietly. “To put it out there in… the universe. And you’ll see her tomorrow, anyway.”“I think…” Buck took a huge breath, breathing deep into his chest, past the hurt, past the hard rock of anxiety that sat at its center, past the tears welling in his eyes; he aimed all of it back out, straight into the heart of the deep, deep universe.“I think I met my daughter tonight.” or;A work of fate or God or man or the universe crosses the paths of Buck and a small, green-eyed girl with a bird in her palm and the future in her snaggle-toothed grin. Two and a half years after the events of Lighthouse, the Diazes become the Diazes.

entry.title: Between his hands - Part. 6 - Submission
entry.summary:
Author: 911_by_Jane

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,350Chapters: 4/5Kudos: 32

Summary: Where secrets, fears, and unexpected desires shatter the delicate balance of their relationship.After the ordeals that nearly cost him his life, Buck has managed to rebuild himself. His body has healed, his certification is validated, and Eddie's love has given him the strength to get back on his feet. But a persistent pain forces him to seek a medical opinion, and the ensuing revelations shake his entire world.Buck finds himself facing a choice that confronts his deepest fears. He believes he must give up his old life, Eddie's love, everything he has built. But Eddie, more determined than ever, won't let him go. He wants the world with him, and he is ready to do anything to convince him that their future has just begun.Will Buck be able to accept being loved for who he is, and embrace this new, unexpected life, filled with doubts, joy, and fears?I'm not very good to English, so please forgive any mistakes I didn't spot (there may be a lot.)

Author: Ilove911onABC

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,919Chapters: 15/20Kudos: 34

Shocked to find each other there, they play along and date other contestants, but jealousy and chemistry keep pulling them back together. A twist pairs them on a date, where long-hidden feelings finally surface.

entry.title: how do i tell you? (i got it from him)
entry.summary:
Author: starsandthesea

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,000Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 51

Summary: "And god Buck, he really does love you so much. I don’t think that there is a single thing you could do, aside from maybe like, I don’t know, killing Chris-”“I would never do that,” Buck cuts her off, offended that she would even bring up such an idea.“No, no, Buck, I know. That’s my point, I don’t think there’s anything that you could- or would ever do that would ruin things with Eddie, or make him resent you,” She shakes her head, “He looks at you like you hung the moon, Buck. Between you and me, I think he’s been in love with you for years- about as long as you have with him.”“Maddie, I- what- I haven’t” Buck splutters, his face turning red.“Right,” Maddie deadpans, rolling her eyes or: Eddie asks buck to move in with him and buck freaks out...loosely inspired by lyrics of How Do I Tell You by Lizzy Mcalpine

entry.title: Gravity’s Got Nothing on You
entry.summary:
Author: Iceprincess96

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,990Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 83

Summary: Buck had always been a tactile guy — handsy, affectionate, maybe a little too comfortable in Eddie’s space. But lately, something’s shifted. It starts with a tight tank top, a pair of fitted pants, and the dangerous curve of Eddie’s waist.Buck tries to play it cool. He fails spectacularly.Between waist-grabbing, lingering touches, and a growing obsession he can’t explain, Buck’s losing the ability to act normal around his best friend — and Eddie’s soft whimpers aren’t helping.

entry.title: Falling in Between
entry.summary:
Author: pipisgram

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,791Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 5

Summary: Eddie and Buck meet in college, where late nights, shared classes, and quiet conversations spark a friendship that changes them both. Eddie learns more from Buck than he ever expected, but college is only a bubble-and bubbles eventually burst.Years pass before an unexpected encounter brings them back into each other’s lives. They’re older now, shaped by distance and choices, carrying wounds the other never saw. To move forward, they’ll have to re-meet each other, forgive what’s past, and decide if what they once had can become something more.

entry.title: Where the Coffee Comes with a Bullet to the Heart
entry.summary:
Author: Noel803

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,337Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 18

Summary: Eddie Diaz’s order was simple: become a regular at the 118, a coffee house with suspected ties to organized crime. His captain wanted him to get close to the staff so they could expose the truth behind their overly polite smiles, suspiciously well-priced coffee, and ever shifting open hours. Only Eddie wasn’t supposed to get this close. But damn it, how was he supposed to avoid falling for the hot barista behind the counter who always signed his cup with a heart. Lines between personal and professional, right and wrong, love and danger soon become a hazy memory and fuck it if Eddie cares.Or the coffee-shop-mafia Buddie AU that nobody asked me for!

entry.title: Tolling of the Bell
entry.summary:
Author: fallenandinlovewithhumanity

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,409Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 18

Summary: Robert Wade Nash did not consider himself the heart of the 118, that honor was split between his firefighters and their families, they made the 118 more than a number. Now, the 118 must face their biggest challenge yet, grieving their Captain, father, husband, and friend. With Chim and Hen healing from their wounds, Buck begins to care for the others with abandon, taking Bobby's last words to heart. And Athena holds hers like a prayer, reaching for them as things suddenly stop adding up.
